title: Effect of Hypericum perforatum (St John's wort) in major depressive disorder
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated hypericum perforatum in adults with major depressive disorder. Results showed that no significant benefit over placebo on the primary outcome; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Effect of Hypericum perforatum (St John's wort) in major depressive disorder.” PubMed, 2002, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11939866/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Superior efficacy of St John's wort extract WS 5570 versus placebo in major depression
population: Adults with mild to moderate depression
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated hypericum extract WS 5570 in adults with mild to moderate depression. Results showed that greater improvement in depressive symptoms compared with placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Superior efficacy of St John's wort extract WS 5570 versus placebo in major depression.” PubMed, 2006, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/16796730/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: St John's wort for depression (Cochrane Review)
results_summary: This systematic review of rcts evaluated hypericum extracts in adults with depressive disorders. Results showed that greater effectiveness than placebo and similar to standard antidepressants in many trials; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “St John's wort for depression (Cochrane Review).” PubMed, 2005, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15846605/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: St John's wort for depression: meta-analysis of randomised controlled trials
results_summary: This meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials evaluated hypericum extracts in adults with depressive disorders. Results showed that mixed efficacy across studies with variability by extract and study quality; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “St John's wort for depression: meta-analysis of randomised controlled trials.” PubMed, 2005, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15684231/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Hypericum perforatum versus sertraline for major depression
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated hypericum perforatum compared with sertraline in adults with major depression. Results showed that comparable responses in mild to moderate cases and fewer adverse events with hypericum; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Hypericum perforatum versus sertraline for major depression.” PubMed, 2000, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/10888483/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Hypericum perforatum in seasonal affective disorder
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated hypericum perforatum in adults with seasonal affective disorder. Results showed that improvement in depressive symptoms versus placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Hypericum perforatum in seasonal affective disorder.” PubMed, 2001, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/11447620/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Hypericum perforatum extract in somatoform disorders
results_summary: This randomized double-blind trial evaluated hypericum perforatum extract in adults with somatoform disorders. Results showed that improved symptom scales compared with placebo; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Hypericum perforatum extract in somatoform disorders.” PubMed, 2003, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/14635171/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Interactions between St John's wort and prescription medications
population: Adults exposed to Hypericum with concomitant medications
results_summary: This systematic review evaluated st john’s wort and drug interactions in adults exposed to concomitant medications. Results showed that induction of drug-metabolizing enzymes leading to reduced plasma drug concentrations; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Interactions between St John's wort and prescription medications.” PubMed, 2004, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/15123844/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: Efficacy and tolerability of Hypericum extracts for depression: meta-analysis
study_type: Systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized trials
results_summary: This systematic review and meta-analysis of randomized trials evaluated hypericum extracts in adults with depressive disorders. Results showed that superiority to placebo and comparability to SSRIs for mild to moderate depression with better tolerability; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “Efficacy and tolerability of Hypericum extracts for depression: meta-analysis.” PubMed, 2016, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/27146012/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.

title: St John's wort (Hypericum perforatum) fresh plant tincture for major depression
results_summary: This randomized controlled trial evaluated fresh plant tincture of hypericum perforatum in adults with major depressive disorder. Results showed that improvement in HAM-D17 scores with acceptable tolerability; mostly minor adverse events reported. Effects were generally modest and safety signals were acceptable, but larger and longer trials are recommended.
mla_citation: “St John's wort (Hypericum perforatum) fresh plant tincture for major depression.” PubMed, 2024, https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/40906611/. Accessed 24 Oct. 2025.
